snippet: Shares in Facebook fell more than 6 percent, to $19.87, on Thursday amid fears that early investors, including like Accel Partners and Goldman Sachs, that were eligible to sell their shares would dump the stock and create a surplus on the market,...
abstract: Shares in Facebook fell more than 6 percent, to $19.87, on Thursday amid fears that early investors, including like Accel Partners and Goldman Sachs, that were eligible to sell their shares would dump the stock and create a surplus on the market, Somini Sengupta reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Facebook Shares Hit New Low as Lockup Period Ends
